dao

Class AbstractDAO<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dao.AbstractDAO<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OrdersDAO

    public class AbstractDAO<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the queries needed to operate on the database. It can be used on any type of class from the model package through reflection.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Stefan Ciuprina

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDAO

        public AbstractDAO(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Sets the type variable based on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        type - Must specify the class type that will be used (theClassType.class). For example, if T is Clients, the parameter given should be Clients.class.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(T element)
        Inserts the element given as parameter in the according table (the one with the same name).
        Parameters:
        element - can be of any type of the model package

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes the element given as parameter from the according table (the one with the same name).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to be deleted

      • find

        private java.util.ArrayList<T> find(java.lang.String field,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    boolean isString)
        Private method that searches the table with the same name as T for fields that are equal to a specific value.
        Parameters:
        isString - the value may be also an integer; in that case, it will be converted from string using Integer.parseInt
        Returns:
        a list of all the found elements satisfying the given condition.

      • getTs

        private java.util.ArrayList<T> getTs(java.lang.String query)
        Executes the query given as argument.
        Returns:
        a list of the found elements after executing the query

      • find

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> find(java.lang.String field,
                                   java.lang.String value)
        Executes the private find method, setting the isString value of that method according to the type of the value parameter.
        Returns:
        a list of all the found elements satisfying the given condition.

      • find

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> find(java.lang.String field,
                                   int value)

      • update

        private void update(java.lang.String idName,
                    int id,
                    java.lang.String field,
                    java.lang.String value,
                    boolean isString)
        Private method running the code for the public update methods based on the isString type.
        Parameters:
        isString - is true if value parameter is a string or false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String idName,
                   int id,
                   java.lang.String field,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Updates the element given as parameter from the according table (the one with the same name), searching it by id (which in the table may not be the "id" field necessarily, but "something_id", that's why it is specified through idName variable. Finally, the field and value variables specify which field should be updated and with what new value.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String idName,
                   int id,
                   java.lang.String field,
                   int value)
        Updates the element given as parameter from the according table (the one with the same name), searching it by id (which in the table may not be the "id" field necessarily, but "something_id", that's why it is specified through idName variable. Finally, the field and value variables specify which field should be updated and with what new value.

      • getAllFields

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> getAllFields()
        Returns:
        a list of all fields of the table with the same name as T

      • getLastID

        public int getLastID()
        Returns:
        the highest ID value of the table with the same name as T

      • createInsertQuery

        private java.lang.String createInsertQuery(int numberOfElements)
        Private method creating the query for inserting elements.
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements - since our tables may have only 3 or 4 elements, this variable can be only 3 or 4.
        Returns:
        the query to be executed by the insert method.
